properties.media:imagetext:
CH
Thursday
May &, 1935.
Déar Family:
writing this letter en route from Canton northward.
left Canton at 8:45
A.M, and now at 7:05 we are flying at 3000 feet over
the rich delta lands of the Pearl River.
le are climbing all the time
for ahead is a four thousand foot high mountain range which we must
gross in order to reach the coast near famous, or rather infamous,
Bey, north of Hongkong.
Bias Bay is the breeding ground and
headquarters for Chinese pirates.
The bay is too
shallow for Chinese
to enter in pursuit of pirate junks and if amaller eraft chase
the pirates into the
bay & they
are apt to be set upon by the armored
junks and may come off second best.
Flew down to Canton on Monday
with five members of the American
Economio Mission.
The Chairman of the
Mission is the Hon. W. Cameron
Forbes,
formerly Governor General of the Philippines.
His grandfather
came to Canton 100 years
ago and organized the
firm of Russell & Co.
which was a most suacessful
American trading concern.
The old Clipper
ships of Russell
& Company carried silk and tea to Boston and I suspeot
the firm also did a considerable volume in opium as most of the other
treders did in those early days.
te spent two busy days at Canton #1th
every minute taken up by
sightseeing and
is a strange 6010g
the t in China the
official calls.
energetic progressive and
adventurious people live in the south, while the northerners are more
Or 1858
content with things as they are and ever have been.
In Canton 1 met General Art Lim of the Canton Air Forge who
is an old time pilot who learned to fly before the world
He brought
"crates" to Canton and
made a number of flights before
he erseked up.
One amusing story which is told about him relates how
the sailors
on the three Cantonese battleships mutinied and started
down river for the open sea.
Art Lim was offered $1000 to attack the
He had no aerial bombs so he filled sone
quart whiskey bottles
whth high that do end at ed natio. He then dove his plane close to the
fleeing warships and hurled the bottles on the decks - the breaking
sparking nails and gasoline set fire to the ships and scared
mutineers so badly that they all jumped over board or surrendered.
triumphantly back to the airport where a large crowd had
gathered,
removed his helmet and goggles to acknowledge the plaudits of
whereupon according to
the story, his eyes filled with
he couldn't see sone trees on the edge of the field. At any rate he
spent several months in the hospital.
He landed at Swatow and then again at Amoy where
These passengers had
I almost became physically 111.
As a matter of fact one of the Chinese
became airsick and that delicate odor was a delightful antidote for the
Fortunately the garlio gentry
only rode to Foochow and now
on with my letter.
chevalier of the merioan Mission and
traveling back to
Shanghai on the regular scheduled plane.
other members are leaving by special plane from Canton & noon and will
stay over
night at Foochow.
On Saturday the entire party will fly to
Isingtao staying there until Monday and
then continue on to Tientsin
few days and then to Peiping.
by rail
to Hankow and then up the river to Chungking by sir.
them most of the time but will have to
get away once in awhile
so as to keep up with developments and business at Shanghai.
and all the girle are going to Feiping on May 4th and
stay there while I am traveling around with
the Mission.
as
EVEr
Harow
$880.151,90
